title: ICE: librustc_typeck/astconv.rs assertion triggered by broken UFCS

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
# STR

```rust
use std::marker::PhantomData;

struct A<T> {
    x: PhantomData<T>,
}

impl A<()> {
    fn foo() -> A<()> {
        <A<()> as A<()>>::foo()
    }
}

impl<T> A<T> {
    fn foo() -> A<T> {
        A { x: PhantomData }
    }
}

fn main() {}
```

# Output

```
error[E0404]: `A` is not a trait
 --> x.rs:9:19
  |
9 |         <A<()> as A<()>>::foo()
  |                   ^^^^^^^^^^^ expected trait, found struct

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)` (left: `Some(A<()>)`, right: `None`)', ../src/librustc_typeck/astconv.rs:1449
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.
```
